Two of the Clowns in Synapse have  become disillusioned. They have recently discovered that 42 is the answer to life , universe and everything and they keep searching this number or its binary equivalent(10101010) in all small things in life.Help them in their path to enlightenment.   


Input
There are exactly 10 lines of input, each line containing a number which is a power of 2, starting from 2^1 and less than or equal to 2^10.


Output
Corresponding to ith line, you need to output the number of times 101010 is present in the numbers starting from 0 up to the one specified in the ith line. Overlapping occurrences of 101010 should not be counted. For example, 10101010 contains only one occurrence.



Example
32
64
128
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Sample Output:
0
1
4
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

Note: The . in input and output indicate an unspecified number (kept only to avoid confusion in format specification). The acutal input format will be ten numbers, one in each line.
